page.title: 11STOKE CLIMSLAND CHURCH
page.content: THE{CHURCH}HAS A RECORDED{HISTORY}BACK TO{1265}WHEN RICHARD, EARL OF CORNWALL APPOINTED MATTHEW DE CELLES TO BE THE FIRST RECTOR. CHURCH RECORDS AT THAT TIME WERE VERY BADLY KEPT AND DURING THE PERIOD{BETWEEN1265 AND 1324 THE {NAME OF THE PATRON SAINT WAS LOST. A REDEDICATION TOOK PLACE ON {ST.FAITH'S DAY}BUT TO THIS DAY THE CHURCH IS NOT DEDICATED TO ANY SAINT AND IS KNOWN SIMPLY AS STOKE CLIMSLAND CHURCH. SINCE THE EARLIEST TIME OF THE CHURCH THE{RECTORS}HAVE HAD THE {PATRONAGE OF THE CROWN OR THE PRINCE {OF WALES. THE PRESENT RECTOR, TERENCE {FULLER,}WHOSE PATRON IS THE PRESENT PRINCE OF WALES HAS RECENTLY BEEN MADE THE{RURAL DEAN}OF THE AREA.
